snippet: Seventeen students were admitted after participating in an experiment that invited prospective freshmen to compose essays on scholarly topics instead of submitting traditional applications.
abstract: Bard College invites prospective freshmen to dispense with standard admission process and simply write four long essays chosen from a menu of 21 scholarly topics; professors deem 17 of those who completed applications worthy of admission, for an acceptance rate that is just a few percentage points lower than Bard’s overall rate.
lead_paragraph: Seventeen students were admitted after participating in an experiment that invited prospective freshmen to compose essays on scholarly topics instead of submitting traditional applications.

headline.main: Bard College Applicants Trade 10,000 Words for Two: You’re In
headline.print_headline: Students Trade 10,000 Words for 2: You’re In
